value.name: Former Scottish Labour leader Kezia Dugdale admits voting SNP
value.description: A former leader of the Labour Party in Scotland has admitted voting SNP. Kezia Dugdale told a new BBC documentary she was "so mad about Brexit" she backed the party at the European Parliament election in 2019. She said she had voted Labour at every election since.

value.name: SNP ‘spin, secrecy and destruction of evidence’ leaves three questions unanswered, Labour says
value.description: Scottish Labour’s deputy leader Jackie Baillie accused the SNP of “completely betraying” families who lost loved ones during the pandemic. She said: “Despite the extraordinary work the inquiry is doing to uncover the truth, the SNP’s spin, secrecy and destruction of evidence has left us all with unanswered questions.

value.name: Genetic link found to emotional sensitivity in stressful situations
value.description: By Neha Mathur In a recent study published in Scientific Reports , researchers assess how genetic variation in a cluster of differentiation 38 ( CD38 ) is associated with increased personal distress in an emotionally evocative situation.

value.name: Now Forbes issues warning to Humza over tax rises
value.description: Humza Yousaf is facing criticism from within his own party over his decision to land Scots with increased taxes.

value.name: Watchdog to probe SNP ministers in deleted WhatsApp messages furore
value.description: A formal investigation into the Scottish Government's use of WhatsApp messages has been launched by Scotland's information commissioner.

value.name: Record number of Scottish patients waited longer than four hours in A&E in 2023
value.description: The figures, calculated by taking weekly A&E performance figures since 2016, also saw a record 141,199 waiting longer than eight hours and 55,995 waiting 12 hours or more in 2023.

value.name: Don’t drag civil servants down with SNP failings
value.description: The Covid inquiry is rightly trying to work out how the pandemic could have been handled better but officials were only doing their best to help Scotland

value.name: SNP blames Westminster cuts for falling behind on green heating ambition
value.description: The SNP has blamed Westminster cuts after concerns were raised that Scotland is falling behind on its ambition to phase out fossil fuel heating in homes. Drew Hendry, the party’s economy spokesman in the Commons, said less money means “less can be done”.

value.name: Westminster should 'face same level of scrutiny as Scotland' on Covid
value.description: WESTMINSTER politicians should face the same levels of scrutiny as Scottish ministers have at the UK Covid Inquiry, an SNP MP has said.

value.description: The Scottish Government is to be investigated by the country’s transparency tsar after Nicola Sturgeon and others destroyed potential evidence
